messages.message: seeing this in webapp local minikube env, i took the latest pull from master. cc: @Jessica @Eric Han
:thinking_face: looks like maybe the build wasn’t run
disclaimer: i am building webapp without the docs, i commented out all the docs related stuff in dockerfile
how are you running the build? are you running it from within `js/webpacked` ?
I’m not familiar with that command
looks like it cannot find static files, can it be your change @Eric Han?
I’m seeing this on local as well. I can’t actually run instabase locally right now
Is nginx up? The building of static files happens in nginx build now
Btw I get nginx: [emerg] invalid number of arguments in “ssl_protocols” directive in /etc/nginx/nginx.conf:58 in nginx
@Jonathan Shih i think @Ashish can help you with this error.
@Eric Han, in my cases, nginx is up, still this is not working. I hope this is okay: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C06FA6A23/p1587433666411700?thread_ts=1587432363.411000&cid=C06FA6A23
When you build nginx are you running fetch static step from the makefile
looks like fetch-static is run  (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/webserver/server-nginx/Makefile#L70)while building for minikube
Can you look in that destination folder and see those static files are there in the right structure? I think it's like webroot/static

Inside server-nginx pod:
```ibuser@deployment-server-nginx-7fb79f596-zjtp2:/$ ls webroot/static/
alive.txt  assets  css-out  fonts  js-out  webpacked```
```
ibuser@deployment-server-nginx-7fb79f596-zjtp2:/$ ls webroot/static/js-out/
bootstrap.js  multiselect-compiled.js  react-deps.js  toastr.js.map  webapp-deps.js```
*update*: the issue has been identified. @Eric Han will ship the change. Thanks eric. :slightly_smiling_face:
